ನಗರದಲ್ಲಿದ್ದರೂ ನರಕದ ಭಯ ತಪ್ಪದು nagaradalliddarū narakada bhaya tappadu (prov.) your current position can never save you from being punished after death (if you are a sinner); ನರಕಕ್ಕೆ ನವದ್ವಾರ, ನಾಕಕ್ಕೆ ಏಕದ್ವಾರ narakakke navadvāra, nākakke ēkadvāra (prov.) there are lot ways that lead to hell, while virtuousness is the only path for heaven; ನರಕದಲ್ಲಿ ಕರುಣವಿಲ್ಲ, ಸ್ವರ್ಗದಲ್ಲಿ ಮರಣವಿಲ್ಲ narakadalli karuṇavilla, svargadalli maraṇavilla (prov.) (said as a warning) once committed to hell, one cannot expect sympathy; ನರಕದಲ್ಲಿ ಬಿದ್ದವನಿಗೆ ಹರುಕು ಬಟ್ಟೆಯಾದರೇನು? narakadalli biddavanige haruku baṭṭeyādarēnu (prov.) rags do not deepen the completely wretched state of life one is in; ನರಕದಲ್ಲಿ ಬೀಳುವವನು ಹರಕೆ ಹೊತ್ತರೆ ತಪ್ಪೀತೆ? narakadalli bīḷuvavanu harake hottare tappīte (prov.) a vow in propitiation can never be a perfect expiation for a sinner; one has to pay the price for one's own sins; ನರಕದಲ್ಲಿ ಭೇದವಿಲ್ಲ, ಸ್ವರ್ಗದಲ್ಲಿ ರೋಗವಿಲ್ಲ narakadalli bhēdavilla, svargadalli rōgavilla (prov.) once committed to hell, no discrimination can be expected; ನರಕದಲ್ಲಿರುವವರು ನಾಕವನ್ನು ಬಯಸಿದ ಹಾಗೆ narakadalliruvavaru nākavannu bayasida hāge (prov.) committed to hell, one cannot imagine going to heaven without undergoing the punishment ordained; ನರಕವುಂಟು ಎಂದು ಅಳುತ್ತಿದ್ದರೆ, ತಪ್ಪೀತೆ? narakavuṇṭu endu aḷuttiddare tappīte (prov.) dead sure are the repercussions that one's sins bring, however one grieves; ನಾ ಅಂದರೆ ನರಕ, ನೀ ಅಂದರೆ ನಾಕ nā andare naraka, nī andare nāka (prov.) egoism hatches sins, while renunciation brings heaven.
any wicked deed that causes the doer to be punished in the hell after death.
= ನರಕಕೂಪ.
(myth.) a deep ditch in the hell where the wicked are punished.
(fig.) a wretched place or condition.
= ನರಕಕೂಪ.
the condemned life of a wretched soul in the hell.
a condemned, inhuman or extremely vexatious life.
a man who has led a wicked life deserving condemnation in the hell; a wicked man.
a woman who has led a wicked life deserving condemnation in the hell; a wicked woman.
the day previous to the full moon-day in the month ofāśvayuja, the seventh month in the Hindu lunar calendar.
the festival observed on that day.
a kind of perfume.
a soul condemned in the hell.

(Jain.) the nether realm of the devil and the demons in which the damned suffer punishment; a hell.
the fear of hell (that makes a man to be discerning about wicked and virtuous acts).
a man deserving condemnation in the hell; a wicked man.
a woman deserving condemnation in the hell; a wicked woman.
the plant Gironniera cuspidata (= G. reticulata) of Ulmaceae family; hellish incense.
torture inflicted to a wicked person in the hell.
(fig.) intolerable torture or great pain; agonising mental or physical pain.
the wretched life of a wicked person in the hell.
(fig.) the state of misery, torment or torture.
a soul condemned in the hell.
a poet not having poetic talent and vision; an ordinary poet.

a despicable or insignificant human being.

to utter a deep sound expressing pain, distress; to groan.
a meek, stupid, timid, submissive person; a sheepish person.

(pros.) a meter in which each line of the verse has one group of three short syllabic instants, one group of three syllables with the central one being short and other two long, followed by a long syllable (totalling to 9 syllabic units).
a disease causing the veins in the neck to become knotty.

all the nerve cells and nervous tissues in an organism, including, in the vertebrates, the brain, spinal cord, ganglia, nerves, and nerve centres, which coordinates and controls responses to stimuli and conditions behaviour and consciousness; the nervous system.
a group consisting of one long followed by a short and a long syllabic instants; amphimacer.
a group consisting of three short syllabic instants; tribrach.
a kind of plant.
